newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Bank/Portugal to accept corporate debt in repos.
newsitem.headline: Bank/Portugal to accept corporate debt in repos.

text.p: The Bank of Portugal said that from July 21 it would accept corporate debt paper in its repurchase pact tenders.
The Bank said that debt issued by international organisations would also be acceptable. Previously, repo pacts had operated only with Portuguese government paper.
The move was part of preparations for the launch of the European single currency in 1999. It should also boost liquidity in the local capital market, it said.
Corporate and international debt would need to meet certain minimum requirements in terms of ratings and be eligible for quotation on the Lisbon bourse, the Bank added.
